DOC.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics LCQ908 Patients With Hepatic Impairment
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : Individuals hepatic impairment • Hepatic impairment evidence ChildPugh score Mild hepatic impairment define ChildPugh Class A ( 56 point ) Moderate hepatic impairment define ChildPugh Class B ( 79 point ) Severe hepatic impairment define ChildPugh Class C ( 1015 point ) . Healthy subject • Good health determine . Exclusion criterion : All Individuals A past medical history clinically significant ECG abnormality family history prolong QTinterval syndrome . Female subject must non child bear potential use effective method contraception . Individuals hepatic impairment History drug alcohol abuse within 3 month prior dose . History presence significant uncontrolled disease major organ class . Any surgical medical condition hepatic impairment might alter drug metabolism . Healthy subject History presence significant uncontrolled disease major organ class . Any surgical medical condition hepatic impairment might alter drug metabolism . History presence hepatitis B C and/or positive Hepatitis B surface antigen ( HBsAg ) Hepatitis C test result screening . Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criterion may apply .
